questions.question: National Income Accounting is a system used to measure:

options.A: The total wealth of all individuals
options.B: The total volume of exports only
options.C: The aggregate economic activity of a nation
options.D: The amount of money printed by the central bank

questions.question: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) measures the total market value of all final goods and services produced:

options.A: By citizens of a country, regardless of where they live
options.B: Within the domestic borders of a country in a given period

questions.question: The difference between GDP and GNP is:
Which of the following is NOT a method of calculating National Income?
In the expenditure approach, GDP is calculated as $C + I + G + (X - M)$. What does 'G' represent?
Final goods are those that are:

options.A: Used as raw materials for other products
options.B: Sold to the ultimate user and not for resale
options.C: Produced in the last month of the year

questions.question: The problem of 'Double Counting' in GDP is avoided by:

options.B: Counting only the value added at each stage of production

questions.question: Net Domestic Product (NDP) is calculated by subtracting ________ from GDP:
Transfer payments, such as pensions and unemployment benefits, are:

options.A: Included in GDP because they represent income
options.B: Excluded from GDP because they do not reflect current production
options.D: Only counted if they come from abroad

questions.question: Real GDP is adjusted for:

options.C: Changes in the quality of goods

questions.question: If Nominal GDP is higher than Real GDP, it implies that:

options.A: The economy is in a recession
options.B: Prices have increased since the base year

questions.question: The GDP Deflator is used to measure:

options.B: The overall price change in the economy

questions.question: Personal Income (PI) refers to:

options.A: The total income received by households before taxes
options.B: The total income after paying all taxes

questions.question: Disposable Personal Income (DPI) is equal to:
Which of the following is an example of an intermediate good?

options.A: A loaf of bread bought by a consumer
options.B: Flour bought by a bakery to make bread
options.C: A new car bought by a family
options.D: A laptop bought by a student

questions.question: The income approach to GDP adds up which of the following?
Per Capita GDP is calculated by dividing GDP by:

options.B: The total number of employed people

questions.question: Economic growth is typically measured by the annual percentage change in:
If a country's exports exceed its imports, it has a:
Value Added is defined as:

options.A: The price of the final product
options.B: The value of output minus the cost of intermediate inputs
options.C: The profit made by a firm
options.D: The tax paid on a product

questions.question: Non-market activities, such as housework performed by family members, are:

options.B: Excluded from GDP because they lack market prices
options.D: Only included in the income method

questions.question: The 'Underground Economy' or black market activity is:

options.B: A reason why GDP may understate true production

questions.question: GDP does not account for the 'Quality of Life' because it ignores:
Net Factor Income from Abroad (NFIA) is positive if:

options.B: Income earned by citizens abroad is greater than income earned by foreigners domestically

questions.question: The base year in Real GDP calculation is the year:

options.B: Whose prices are used as a reference point

questions.question: In the circular flow model, payments for factors of production flow from:

options.D: Firms to the rest of the world

questions.question: Indirect taxes include which of the following?
Investment (I) in GDP accounting includes:

options.A: Buying shares on the stock market
options.B: Purchase of new machinery and construction of buildings
options.C: Buying an old house built 10 years ago

questions.question: Consumption (C) is the largest component of GDP in most market economies and refers to:

options.B: Household spending on goods and services

questions.question: What is the formula for GNP?

options.B: GDP + Net Factor Income from Abroad
options.C: GDP - Net Factor Income from Abroad

questions.question: The 'Value Added' at the final stage of production is equal to:

options.A: The price of the final good

questions.question: Corporate profit is a component of which method?
National Income (NI) is formally defined as:

options.B: Net National Product (NNP) at factor cost

questions.question: Which of the following would NOT increase a nation's GDP?

options.A: An increase in government road construction
options.B: An increase in people painting their own houses themselves
options.C: An increase in the export of coffee

questions.question: In the circular flow, 'leakages' include:
Inventory investment refers to:

options.B: Changes in the stock of finished goods and raw materials
options.C: The purchase of a new warehouse

questions.question: If a shoe is produced in 2025 but sold in 2026, it is counted in the GDP of:
The 'Injections' into the circular flow of income are:
Nominal GDP is often referred to as:
A high Per Capita GDP generally indicates:

options.B: A higher standard of living on average

questions.question: The 'Services' sector includes:
Subsidies are:

options.A: Taxes paid by firms to the government
options.B: Financial aid given by the government to producers

questions.question: The 'Output Method' sums the production of which three sectors?
What is 'Net Investment'?
GDP at Factor Cost is calculated as:

options.A: GDP at Market Price + Indirect Taxes - Subsidies
options.B: GDP at Market Price - Indirect Taxes + Subsidies

questions.question: A recession is typically defined as two consecutive quarters of:
Net National Product (NNP) is equal to:
Personal Income includes transfer payments but excludes:
The Green GDP is a measurement that attempts to account for:

options.C: The growth of the agricultural sector

questions.question: Economic welfare is better represented by 'Real Per Capita GDP' because it accounts for both:
